quiz.text: Recently (In July 2023), the report, X was prepared by International Organization for Migration (IOM) and François-Xavier Bagnoud Center for Health and Human Rights at Harvard University, according to the report __________ of child victims were female and __________ were male.
options: 60.5% and 45.6%
50% and 40%
57.4% and 42.6%
55.4% and 43.6%
44.8% and 55.6%

quiz.text: According to the recently (In July 2023) released “From Evidence to Action: Twenty Years of IOM Child Trafficking Data to Inform Policy and Programming” report, children aged _________ formed the largest group of child victims (46.6%).
options: 1-5
13-17
5-10
6-11
9-13

quiz.text: Recently (In July 2023) International Organization for Migration (IOM) released a report titled “From Evidence to Action: Twenty Years of IOM Child Trafficking Data to Inform Policy and Programming”. Consider the following statements regarding data given in the report.A. Sexual exploitation, including through prostitution, pornography, and sexual servitude, is also prominent, affecting 50% of trafficked children, predominantly girls.B. Child victims reported being exploited in domestic work (19.5%)C. Child victims reported being exploited in begging (20.2%)Which of the following statements are incorrect?
options: Only A
Only B
Both A and B
Both A and C
A, B and C

Conservation International

quiz.text: According to the recently (In July 2023) released “Progress on household drinking water, sanitation and hygiene 2000–2022: special focus on gender”, between 2015 and 2022, household access to safely managed drinking water increased from 69% to ________.
options: 80%
75%

quiz.text: As per the recently (In July 2023) released X Index, in India ________ poor people moved out of poverty from 2005/2006 to 2019/2021 (In span of 15 years), with incidence falling from 55.1% in 2005/2006 to ________ in 2019/2021.
options: 415 million and 16.4%
1.1 billion and 18%
600 million and 27%

options: 1.2 billion
1.3 billion
1.1 billion
1.4 billion
2.1 billion

quiz.text: Recently (In July 2023), the Global Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) was released by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and the Oxford Poverty and Human Development Initiative (OPHI). Assets is not one of the indicator on which Global MPI is based.Which of the above statement is incorrect?
options: Only A
Both A and C
Only B
Both A and B

quiz.text: According to recently (In July 2023) released “A world of debt, a growing burden to global prosperity July 2023”, the Global public debt surged to a record _________ in 2022 as governments borrowed to counter crises, such as the COVID-19 pandemic, with the burden being felt acutely by developing countries.
options: $90 trillion
$85 trillion

quiz.text: Recently (In July 2023), “A world of debt, a growing burden to global prosperity July 2023” report was released by the UN Global Crisis Response Group and the five UN Regional Commissions. India's total debt according to the report is US $2815 billionWhich of the above statements are correct?
options: Only A
Only B
Both A and B
Both B and C

quiz.text: According to the recently (In July 2023) released report “2023 UNAIDS Global AIDS Update – The Path That Ends AIDS” by the United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS), the number of people on antiretroviral treatment worldwide rose almost fourfold, from 7.7 million in 2010 to _________ in 2022.

quiz.text: Recently (In July 2023), the “2023 UNAIDS Global AIDS Update – The Path That Ends AIDS” report was released by the United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS). Only B
Both A and B
A, B and C

quiz.text: According to the recently (In July 2023) released report “2023 UNAIDS Global AIDS Update – The Path That Ends AIDS” by the United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS), the number of AIDS-related deaths among children was reduced by 64 per cent in 2010-2022, the HIV pandemic still claimed the lives of approximately ___________ children in 2022

84,000

quiz.text: According to the recently (In July 2023) released report “2023 UNAIDS Global AIDS Update – The Path That Ends AIDS” by the United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS), funding for HIV declined in 2022 from both international and domestic sources, it amounted to $20.8 billion in 2022, far short of the ________ needed by 2025.
options: $39.3 billion
$49.3 billion
$19.3 billion
$29.3 billion
